intro: Conopharyngia chippii, commonly known as the Mexican leafy liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its leafy, thallus-like structure and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant exhibits a dichotomous branching pattern, with small, oval-shaped leaves arranged in two rows. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
